description.narrative: The Access to Water Community Development 2010 program aims to support specific groups experiencing hardship (women, youth, elderly and disabled persons)associated with access to water. Water is in scarce supply throughout Tonga consisting of two sources: bore water, which has a relatively high saline content; and rain water that must be captured and stored safely. Many rural and outer-island do not have access to a town or village water supply which is sourced from bore water. Funding under this initiative will improve the health and quality of lives for 100 households in Tonga through installation of water harvesting equipment. The total value of this initiative is $0.6 million over 2 years, starting 2009-10.
